subject: Productivity
title: Wendy Wood and Everyday Habits
description: A micro-lesson that makes Wendy Wood and Everyday Habits usable.

hook.text: Psychologist Wendy Wood spent thirty years studying why people repeat the same actions daily.

buildup.text: Her research confirmed that habits account for roughly 43% of what people do each day.

discovery.text: Wood found that context, not motivation, is the strongest predictor of habitual behavior.

twist.text: People who moved to new cities broke old habits easily. The old cues simply vanished.

climax.text: Her book Good Habits Bad Habits argues for designing environments instead of relying on willpower.

punchline.text: Change the context and the habits change too.

quiz.question: What did Wendy Wood identify as the strongest predictor of habitual behavior?
